qas.question: What example inspired much of a new Swiss constitution providing for a federal layout?
Under the new Swiss constitution, what did the cantons have the right to self-govern?
How many houses was the Swiss national assembly divided into?
What was the name of the upper house, which included 2 representatives from each canton?
What was the name of the lower house, whose representatives were elected throughout the country?

context: Thus, while the rest of Europe saw revolutionary uprisings, the Swiss drew up a constitution which provided for a federal layout, much of it inspired by the <a0_0>American<a0_0/> example. This constitution provided for a central authority while leaving the cantons the right to self-government on <a1_0>local issues<a1_0/>. Giving credit to those who favoured the power of the cantons (the Sonderbund Kantone), the national assembly was divided between an upper house (the <a3_0>Council of States<a3_0/>, <a2_0>two<a2_0/> representatives per canton) and a lower house (the <a4_0>National Council<a4_0/>, with representatives elected from across the country). Referenda were made mandatory for any amendment of this constitution.
